newsitem.title: USA: Citadel to buy back 23 pct of its shares.
newsitem.headline: Citadel to buy back 23 pct of its shares.

text.p: Citadel Computer Systems Inc said on Monday that it will repurchase 3.9 million shares of its common stock, or about 23 percent, from two directors under the company's consolidations of its Houston operations into Dallas.
Gil Gertner and George Sharep will remain as company directors and will retain about 1.2 million shares of stock, plus options, Citadel said.
In a related agreement, the two directors will buy $2.8 million in aged accounts receivable, in exchange for the stock and termination of Shapr's employment contract, Citadel said.
Citadel said Sharp and Gertner will assume the company's obligations associated with the Houston office, equipment leases and other certain indebtedness.
Citdadel had previoulsy recorded $950,000 in allowances for doubtful accounts and will receive an interest in any receivables collected in excess of $2.25 million, the company said.
The consolidation of operations is expected to save $350,000 per quarter, starting with the quarter ending in August, Citadel said.
